# Table S1. Summary of the MCMC simulations of the marginal posterior distributions of population-level model parameters. 

Mean denotes sample mean, MCSE denotes Monte Carlo Standard Error, StdDev denotes sample standard deviation, 5%, 50%, 95% denote corresponding quantiles, N_Eff denotes effective sample size, R_Hat denotes a measure of chain equilibrium must be within 0.05 of 1.0.

```{r}
fit <- cmdstanr::as_cmdstan_fit(c(
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-1.csv',
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-2.csv',
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-3.csv',
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-4.csv',
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-5.csv',
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-6.csv',
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-7.csv',
                                  '../model/stan/mod50/output/mod50-8.csv'
                                ))
fit$print(variables = c("logkwHat","S1Hat","dlogkwHat","dS1Hat","beta","S2Hat","omega","rho[1,2]","sigma","alpha","sdpi"), max_rows=16)
```

# Figure S2. Functional group effects

A summary of the marginal posterior distributions of the functional group effects. Red represents the effect of dissociated functional groups, and green represents the effect of non-dissociated functional groups. The lest common functional groups (<=10 across all analytes) are presented. The plot for the remaining functional groups is presented in Figure 2.

![](../deliv/figures/manuscript/supplement/parameter-estimates-fg2.pdf)
{{< pagebreak >}}
